intro: Carelia berroi, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the temperate regions of South America. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem, and it prefers well-drained soil in full sun to partial shade. Carelia berroi is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and can thrive in USDA hardiness zones 6 through 9. Its botanical characteristics make it a distinctive addition to the flora of its native habitat.
